column2: pegmorlen, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had severe itching which is related to nerves misfiring, someone recommended capzasin, so I bought and applied to both arms one arm caught on fire the other felt like icy hot it seems to have worked for now, but I told my husband that it burnt the top layer of my skin off so they where no more nerves lol.

column2: none, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had total knee replacement 5 months ago. I still have joint pain especially after exercising/rehab. I ran out of the generic muscle rub I had been using. I bought a tube of Capzasin P and have been very pleased with the performance. I can feel the pain subside immediately after applying Capzasin P and the relief lasts about 4 hours. The relief is comparable to Icy Hot or Equal Line. The cost is about the same as Icy Hot but more than Equal Line. Capzasin has one major advantage to the other products. It comes with a sponge applicator attached to the tube. I never have to get the ointment on my hands like with the other products which is a major advantage in my book. I will continue to use Capzasin over the other products for this reason.

column2: karrots560@aol.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Burned so bad It kept me awake all night.Actually hurt worse then my ankle hurt before I put it on.ran cold water over it ,used cold rag and nothing stopped the burning.Still hurt later on the next day.I will never use it again.Needs to be taken off of market.
oh my Gosh!!!!!!! This is HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!! My boyfriend is dieing from this stuff!!! Take it off the market already!!!!

column2: Grantthegreat, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

Pain was 2nd to childbirth!!

column9: All I experienced was irritation of the skin surface, a burning sensation that I could not stop. Washing with soap and water made it worse and lotions gave no relief. Joints still hurt.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It burned me badly.

column2: Gem, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I used this product on my neck one night because I had strained it and thought it work like Ben-Gay ointment, which has been helpful in the past.  Within 30 seconds of rubbing it into the side of my neck, my skin was on fire and after 15 minutes, the pain was so intense I dug the product out of the trash where I had thrown it, only to see the warning that I should have saved the carton to find out what to do in case of "severe burning sensation" (which of courser I had not done).  I ended up on this website, at least I know I don't have to drive myself to the emergency room! I am using cold compresses and will try the vegetable oil also. The side of my neck is beet red and I actually have raised welts (like hives) on my skin where I applied the "treatment".  I will never use this product again and will try and warn others away from it as well.

column2: asmyth0524@aol.com, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I used Capzasin this morning. Helpful. No problems. Worked outside in heat. Now burning, used cool cloth, dried off, burning getting worse. No longer have box. What should I do?

column2: sheliakerr1956@aol.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: the first use burnt my skin so bad i felt like i had been severly scalded..scrubbed witha soapy washcloth but no help. it gets in the skin deep and quick..i found that if you just use a very light coating with the roll on .it will give relief without the terrible burning.. be careful not to touch your skin and then rub your eye... i found out the hard way....they should put a large warning on that little bottle...

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I used this on my daughter and she was burned very badly. I would not recommend. Vegetable oil seemed to stop the burning.

column2: 45-54 Female  (Patient)
column9: I have tried everything for back pain! I read about Capzasin and thought I'd try it, in the lowest strength possible. Day one, seemed to help. Day 2, seemed to help. 12 hours AFTER applying on day 2, I was woken up from a dead sleep by the sensation that my back was ON FIRE! I washed it off as best as I could at 1 AM, took a Benadryl, I truly thought I was going to go into anaphylactic shock or something! I had a bright red spot on my back the size of a softball. A couple of showers and a soothing lotion the next morning, and it seems to have taken care of it. This product is DANGEROUS! It SHOULD NOT BE ON THE MARKET!  The FDA really needs to look into this!

column2: linda, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It was the first time I have used this medication and two of my doctors recommended it. I had a severe adverse reaction which included very severe burning and skin turning very bright red which  lasted for a couple of hours despite taking a shower, washing with soap, putting vegetable oil on it and then cold cloths as the package recommended. On a scale of pain of 1 -10 with 10 being the most severe pain you have ever experienced this was a 9. It was very severe and I howled loudly. It burned like it was on fire. I was in SEVERE PAIN. It has left the skin very sensitive and uncomfortable even though it has been nearly 24 hours. The redness has dissaptated as has the severe burning, but the skin is very tender and itchy. I will report this event too to the FDA.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Don't know about "pain," but I have constant itching around the shoulder blade.  This condition has a name I can't recall at the moment, but there is no cure and the doctors don't care.  On the Internet, I found that someone had used this ointment.  I have used it for a couple of days and am thrilled.  The slight burning and hot sensation is a welcome relief to an intense itch I can't reach.  I don't care what it does to me otherwise.  I've now had two days of not itching in five years - thanks to this ointment.

column2: 65-74 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: burning sensation to shoulder kept me up all night.

column2: idontknow, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Burned the Day lights out of me with no relief for three days. I tryed every thing the package said. Finally in my cabinet I found some neutralize gel called Miracle 2. it instantly removed all pain and all burning. I will never use this product again.

column2: fire, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My experience with this treatment was a uncontrollable burning sensation, and the effects carried on into the next day.even after taking cold baths and using ice.

column2: Karen, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After trying multipld medications, over the counter and by prescription, I finally tried capzasin. I read the direction inside the box and outside the box. It worked wonders!! Before, I could barely walk or sit in the am due to excruiting pain. After using the capzasin I almost felt like new!!It is the ONLY thing that has helped with my back and leg pain. Aplly spaingly at first to see if you have any reaction. I HIGHLY recommend this ointment.

column2: Keith, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I applied this moderately last night to my hip and back. Within one to two minutes I was suffering excrutiating burning pain. At 52 years old, I was crying like a baby and in distress. I was scrambling for relief. Cold shower, scrub with soap and water, covered with ice. The directions on the outside of the box said to find other instructions printed inside the box itself..ie., cut the product's package open and read additional instructions for severe reactions. The pain was absolutely as severe as having burned myself on the stove or having caught on fire! The only relief came from dousing the skin with vast amounts of vegetable oil as recommended inside the containers packaging. Obviously I had some sort of untypical reaction, however it must not be that uncommon because they do disclose two or three emergency responses if you have the wits about where to find the information. I can not believe this product is allowed to be sold in the U.S. Having said that, my dad has used this for months with no side effects. It scares the hell out of me though, that others could experience what I did and I would not wish that on anyone.

column2: dochawleywood, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: I'm surprised to read the negative comments. I have a tube of Capzasin next to my bed, in the bathroom, and in the bag I carry during the day. It is highly effective. Perhaps it takes some getting used to, which is why people used to over-the-counter treatments that are ineffective were surprised by the heat. I'm sure that highly sensitive skin could be strongly affected by this product.

column2: BL Brown, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Do not use Capzasin!  The burn from the ingredient, HOT PEPPERS, is much worse than the pain of arthritis.  I used it one time and the burning was so bad I couldn't sleep.  It lasted for 24 hours.  No where on the outside of the box or the tube did it warn about the chance of severe burning.  Nor it mention the ingredient until reading on the INSIDE of the box. Also, there is no 800 number to call for help.  This medicine should be pulled from the shelf!

column2: Capzasin, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: merrimacmom, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: TERRIBLE BURNING. Skin red irratiated and felt like it was on fire, even after washing off.   15 hours later Still buring!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I applied the medication to my hips and was unable to work the next day due to the severe pain caused by the capzasin. My skin felt like someone was holding a blow torch to it. I tried to remove the medicine, but was unable to get it all off. 20 + hours later, I am still burning. I was unable to sleep due to the burning and had to put ice packs on to get relief. Taking a hot bath just now to ease the initial hip joint pain(20 some hours after first application and multiple attempts to remove) seemed to reactivate the medication. I am on fire again, but not quite as severely. I will NEVER use this product again and will never recommend it to anyone.

column2: cdanzer, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had knee surguery several months ago; still having some pain so applyed to my knee area but the medication burnt my hand so bad had to soak in ice all night and next morning but my knee feels better.

column2: Kay, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Capzasin numbs pain in my spine and muscles. It also numbs arthritic pain in my joints (ankles/knuckles/shoulders). The mild itching/burning that sometimes occurs is well worth the pain relief. I am taking fewer pain relieving meds (Tylenol and oxycodone) and muscle relaxers (Soma) since using Capzasin. I experienced immediate relief upon the first application. Wish I had known about it long ago.
